title: Building the plane on the runway: Formulating approaches to HIV prevention in the early days of the pandemic

markdown.headingText: Building the plane on the runway: Formulating approaches to HIV prevention in the early days of the pandemic
markdown.markdown:
PUBHLTH 405 Social History of Infectious Disease University of Michigan School of Public Health

Jon Zelner `jzelner@umich.edu` [`epibayes.io`](https://epibayes.io)

## Agenda - Going over mid-semester feedback & course changes - Review episodes 2 & 3 of *Fiasco* - Prep discussion questions for Weds - Review feedback from in-class presentations and make project plans ## What should we keep, and what's for the birds? :::{.columns} :::{.column width=50%} - Miro boards üëé - Classmates not showing up üëé - More diverse content (podcasts etc) üëç - Digesting readings and pre-lecture content through in-class questions in google docs üëç - Food üç© üç¨ üëç ::: :::{.column width=50%} ![My kids, not actually penguins. üêß](../images/20221107140641.png){width=70%} ::: ::: ## Always a balancing act ü§∏‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è :::{.columns} :::{.column width=50%} - Everything just about right üëç - Small group discussions not useful. üëé - Small group discussions good üëç but too short. - Small group discussions helpful üëç but too long. - Less lecture ‚¨áÔ∏è, more activities ‚¨ÜÔ∏è - More lecture ‚¨ÜÔ∏è, fewer activities ‚¨áÔ∏è - More biology ‚¨ÜÔ∏è, less SDOH ‚¨áÔ∏è ::: :::{.column width=50%} :::{.fragment}
Little Girl Meme GIFfrom Little Girl GIFs
Me trying to figure out what to do... ::: ::: ::: ## Feedback on pathogen project - More in-class project workdays would be helpful. - Helpful and interesting to see other group presentations and get feedback. - Uneven attendance, particularly for in-class project work, puts those with consistently missing partners at a disadvantage. ## Changes in response to feedback üîÅ - 15% pathogen project participation grade. - Based on attendance during in-class workdays and feedback from group members. - In-class workdays on 11/14 and 11/28 and 12/7 (partial). - Lightning (~10m) project update presentations on 11/30 - Sign-in on these days (incl. today) # Fiasco Episodes 2 & 3 ## On your own In the [google doc](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1iHtIa94D2avmCJQkTfzcLYkj-IEQX28dKpA2ncio4AI/edit?usp=sharing): 1. What did you find most interesting or surprising in this episode? 2. Where do you think we are in Rosenberg's epidemic trajectory at this point? 3. How would you interpret the role of stigma in the public health, medical, and community response to the crisis up until now? 4. What specific questions or thoughts do you have about these episodes for our Q&A on Weds? ```{r} library(countdown) countdown(minutes = 10, warn_when = 120, seconds = 0, play_sound=TRUE) ``` ## Multi-factorial model of AIDS development ![](../images/20221106120128.png){width=80%} :::{.fragment} ![From (Sonnabend et al., 1984)](../images/20221106120152.png){width=80%} ::: ## Relies on complex ideas about immune function ![](../images/sonnabend_multifactorial_1.png){width=80%} ## Explains both the acquisition phase as well as a transition to self-sustaining disease ![](../images/20221106115400.png){width=80%} :::{.fragment} ![](../images/20221106115219.png){width=80%} ::: ## Some more questions: 1. What are some similarities and differences between the multi-factorial theory of AIDS and the miasma theory of Cholera? 2. In hindsight, where do you think you would have come down on the decision to keep the baths open in San Francisco or force them to close? Why? 3. What parallels do you see between the controversy around pieces like *"We Know Who We Are"* and discourses about masking, vaccination and other aspects of personal choice during COVID-19? ## Getting ready for Weds Q&A - Go into the [google doc](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1iHtIa94D2avmCJQkTfzcLYkj-IEQX28dKpA2ncio4AI/edit?usp=sharing) we have been using to keep track of thoughts/questions about Fiasco Eps 1-3. - Upvote questions or other items that you would like to bring up during our discussion. - Are there any questions specifically relevant to your project? - We will briefly review questions after and I will collate and share w/Madeline & Ula. ```{r} library(countdown) countdown(minutes = 10, warn_when = 120, seconds = 0, play_sound=TRUE) ``` # Pathogen project work time ü¶† ## Next Time - Q&A w/ Ula Kulpa and Madeline Kaplan ## References
